revised_title: Cortical Lamination and Cellular Elements in the Motor Area of the Brain
tldr: The authors investigate the cortical lamination of the motor area of the brain and identify various cellular elements, including neuroglia corpuscles and perivascular cells. They also describe the different layers of the cortex, including pyramidal and oval cells, and discuss the discrepancies between Meynert's and Baillarger's descriptions of cortical layers.
